feature.name: Aaru
feature.origin: Egyptian abode of the blessed dead.

feature.name: Adiri
feature.origin: Melanesian afterworld where life is easier than on Earth.

feature.name: Afekan
feature.origin: New Guinea goddess of creation and knowledge who teaches people how to live correctly.

feature.name: Anbus Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; IV Anbus, home of Tibana, an apologist for Socratic Christianity.

feature.name: Angmar Montes
feature.origin: Name of a mountain range from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Antilia Faculae
feature.origin: Archipelago corresponding to the mythical island of Antilia, once thought to lie midway between Europe and the Americas.

feature.name: Apanohuaya Flumen
feature.origin: Mythological river in the Aztec Underworld.

feature.name: Ara Fluctus
feature.origin: Armenian god famous for his beauty, also known as a resurrected god who dies and is reborn periodically.

feature.name: Arrakis Planitia
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; home of the Fremen, a group of fictional people whose culture revolves around preservation and conservation of water, which is a rare commodity on the planet.

feature.name: Arwen Colles
feature.origin: Daughter of Elrond; character from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Aura Undae
feature.origin: Greek Titanis goddess of the morning wind.

feature.name: Aztlan
feature.origin: Mythical land from which the Aztecs believed they migrated.

feature.name: Bayta Fretum
feature.origin: Bayta Darell, fictional character in Isaac Asimov's Foundation Series, wife of the Trader Tran Darell and grandmother of famous author Arcadia “Arcady” Darell.

feature.name: Beag
feature.origin: Celtic/Irish goddess of water, education, and knowledge. Anyone who drinks the water from her well will become wise.

feature.name: Belet
feature.origin: Malay afterworld reached by a flower-lined bridge.

feature.name: Bermoothes Insula
feature.origin: An enchanted island in Shakespeare’s Tempest.

feature.name: Bilbo Colles
feature.origin: Hobbit, the main character in ‘The Hobbit’ novel; he traveled across Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Bimini Insula
feature.origin: Boicua; Island in Arawak (Bahamas) legend said to contain the fountain of youth.

feature.name: Boreas Undae
feature.origin: Greek god of the north wind.

feature.name: Bralgu Insulae
feature.origin: Baralku; In Yolngu culture (Arnhem Land, Australia), the island of the dead and the place where the Djanggawul, the three creator siblings, originated.

feature.name: Buyan Insula
feature.origin: A rocky island in Russian folk tales located on the south shore of the Baltic Sea.

feature.name: Buzzell Planitia
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; a cold planet, known for its lustrous Soostones, used as a “punishment planet” by the Bene Gesserit.

feature.name: Caladan Planitia
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; the original home of the House Atriedes, a fictional noble family.

feature.name: Ching-tu
feature.origin: Chinese Buddhist paradise where those who attain salvation will live in unalloyed happiness.

feature.name: Chusuk Planitia
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series, known for its musical instruments.

feature.name: Corrin Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; site of Battle of Corrin.

feature.name: Dilmun
feature.origin: Sumerian garden of paradise, primeval land of bliss.

feature.name: Dolmed Montes
feature.origin: Name of a mountain from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Doom Mons
feature.origin: Name of a mountain from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Ecaz Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; useful for its agricultural contributions to the Imperium.

feature.name: Echoriath Montes
feature.origin: Name of a mountain range from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Eir Macula
feature.origin: Norse goddess of healing and peace.

feature.name: Elivagar Flumina
feature.origin: In Norse mythology, twelve poisonous ice-cold rivers.

feature.name: Elpis Macula
feature.origin: Greek goddess of happiness and hope.

feature.name: Erebor Mons
feature.origin: Name of a mountain from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Eurus Undae
feature.origin: Greek personification of the east wind.

feature.name: Faramir Colles
feature.origin: Wise man of nobility; character from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Fensal
feature.origin: In Norse mythology, magnificent mansion of Frigga, to which she invited all married couples who had led virtuous lives on Earth to enjoy each other's company forever.

feature.name: Forseti
feature.origin: Norse god, the wisest and most eloquent of the Aesir.

feature.name: Gammu Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; the name for the planet Giedi Prime after the fall of House Harkonnen.

feature.name: Gamont Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; third planet of Niushe, noted for its hedonistic culture.

feature.name: Gandalf Colles
feature.origin: Wizard, leader of the Fellowship of the Ring; character from Middle-earth, the fictional setting fantasy novels by J. R. R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Ganesa Macula
feature.origin: Hindu god of good fortune and wisdom.

feature.name: Gansireed Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; with a village named London.

feature.name: Garotman Terra
feature.origin: Iranian paradise where the souls of faithful men dwell.

feature.name: Giedi Planitia
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; Giedi Prime is the homeworld of House Harkonnen.

feature.name: Ginaz Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; home of House Ginaz.

feature.name: Gram Montes
feature.origin: Name of a mountain from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Grumman Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; where Duncan Idaho first blooded his sword.

feature.name: Guabonito
feature.origin: Taino Indian (Antilles) sea goddess who taught the use of amulets.

feature.name: Hagal Planitia
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; a jewel planet known for its quality quartz, and which is mined out in the time of Shaddam I.

feature.name: Handir Colles
feature.origin: Son of Haldir, a ruler of the fictional Folk of Haleth; character from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Hano
feature.origin: Bella Coola (northwestern USA and western Canada) goddess of education, knowledge, and magic. She manifested as a shaman so she could teach the people.

feature.name: Hardin Fretum
feature.origin: Salvor Hardin, fictional character in Isaac Asimov's Foundation Series, first Mayor of the planet Terminus.

feature.name: Harmonthep Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from Dune series; sixth stop in the Zensunni migration.

feature.name: Hotei Arcus
feature.origin: One of the seven gods of happiness in Japanese Buddhism. He is the god of contentment, good fortune, cheerfulness, and he is always smiling.

feature.name: Hotei Regio
feature.origin: One of the seven gods of happiness in Japanese Buddhism. He is the god of contentment, good fortune, and cheerfulness, and he is always smiling.

feature.name: Hubur Flumen
feature.origin: The river that flows at the gates of the netherworld in Mesopotamian mythology.

feature.name: Hufaidh Insulae
feature.origin: Legendary island in the marshes of southern Iraq.

feature.name: Irensaga Montes
feature.origin: Name of a mountain from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Junction Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; once controlled by the Spacing Guild, taken over by the Honored Matres as a stronghold for their leader.

feature.name: Kaitain Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; the capital of the Imperium.

feature.name: Kalseru Virga
feature.origin: NW Australian rainbow serpent, bringer of rain.

feature.name: Kivu Lacus
feature.origin: Lake on the border between Rwanda and The Democratic Republic of the Congo.

feature.name: Kraken Mare
feature.origin: Fabulous sea monster in the Norwegian seas, said to be a mile and a half in circumference and to cause a whirlpool when it dives.

feature.name: Krocylea Insulae
feature.origin: Crocylea; Mythological Greek island in the Ionian Sea, near Ithaca.

feature.name: Kronin Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; captured by the Honored Matres.

feature.name: Ksa
feature.origin: Lakota and Oglala (South Dakota, USA) god of wisdom.

feature.name: Kutch Lacuna
feature.origin: Intermittent lake on the border of India and Pakistan.

feature.name: Lampadas Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; a center for Bene Gesserit education, also where Miles Teg is trained as a Mentat.

feature.name: Lankiveil Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; where Glossu Rabban, the nephew of Baron Harkonnen, is a Count.

feature.name: Leilah Fluctus
feature.origin: Persian goddess of beauty and chastity.

feature.name: Lernaeus Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; where Miles Teg retires, also the home planet of his Bene Gesserit mother, Lady Janet Roxbrough.

feature.name: Ligeia Mare
feature.origin: One of the sirens in Greek mythology.

feature.name: Mayda Insula
feature.origin: Legendary island in the northeastern region of the Atlantic Ocean.

feature.name: Merlock Montes
feature.origin: Name of a mountain from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Mezzoramia
feature.origin: Oasis of happiness in the African desert, from an Italian legend.

feature.name: Mindolluin Montes
feature.origin: Name of a mountain from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Misty Montes
feature.origin: Name of a mountain range from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Mithrim Montes
feature.origin: Name of a mountain range from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Mohini Fluctus
feature.origin: Indian goddess of beauty and magic.

feature.name: Momoy
feature.origin: Chumash (California, USA) ancestor shaman and goddess of magic, education, knowledge, health and healing.

feature.name: Moria Montes
feature.origin: Name of three massive peaks, the Mountains of Moria, at the midpoint of the Misty Mountains range from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Muritan Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; place where the son of a female supplicant to Alia Atreides was killed.

feature.name: Mweru Lacus
feature.origin: Lake in Zambia and Democratic Republic of the Congo.

feature.name: Mystis
feature.origin: Greek nymph, a minor deity, nurse of the god Dionysus, who instructed him in the Mysteries.

feature.name: Naraj Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; where the son of Farok lost his eyes.

feature.name: Neagh Lacus
feature.origin: Lake in Northern Ireland, United Kingdom.

feature.name: Nimloth Colles
feature.origin: Second queen of Doriath, a fictional realm of Grey Elves; character from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Niushe Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; planet captured by the Honored Matres.

feature.name: Notus Undae
feature.origin: Greek god of the south or southwest wind.

feature.name: Ochumare Regio
feature.origin: Puerto Rican goddess of happiness and weather.

feature.name: Ohrid Lacus
feature.origin: Lake on the border of Macedonia and Albania.

feature.name: Omacatl Macula
feature.origin: Aztec god of good cheer and lord of banquets.

feature.name: Ontario Lacus
feature.origin: Lake on the border between Canada and the United States.

feature.name: Palma Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; home to a Bene Gesserit Keep, attacked by the Honored Matres.

feature.name: Paxsi
feature.origin: Aymara (Peru, Bolivia) goddess of the moon, education and knowledge.

feature.name: Penglai Insula
feature.origin: Mythological Chinese mountain island where immortals lived.

feature.name: Perkunas Virgae
feature.origin: Lithuanian supreme god, ruler of rain, thunder, and lightning.

feature.name: Planctae Insulae
feature.origin: In Greek mythology the “wandering rocks”, between which the sea was mercilessly violent. Only Argo was said to have successfully passed the rocks.

feature.name: Polaznik Macula
feature.origin: Slavic god of New Year's happiness.

feature.name: Polelya Macula
feature.origin: East Slavic god of matrimonial happiness.

feature.name: Poritrin Planitia
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; third planet of Epsilon Alangue, considered by many Zensunni Wanderers as their planet of origin.

feature.name: Prespa Lacus
feature.origin: Lake in the Republic of Macedonia, Albania, and Greece.

feature.name: Puget Sinus
feature.origin: Sound in state of Washington, USA.

feature.name: Punga Mare
feature.origin: Māori (New Zealand) supernatural being, the father of sharks and lizards. Son of the sea god Tangaroa.

feature.name: Qinghai Lacus
feature.origin: Kukunor, Tso Ngonpo; lake in China.

feature.name: Quivira
feature.origin: Legendary city in the American Southwest; site of a fabulous treasure sought by Coronado and other explorers.

feature.name: Rerir Montes
feature.origin: Name of a mountain from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Richese Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; fourth planet of Eridani A, supreme in machine culture, noted for miniaturization.

feature.name: Rohe Fluctus
feature.origin: Beautiful Māori goddess, wife of Māui.

feature.name: Romo Planitia
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; the planet on which the younger brother of Miles Teg was poisoned.

feature.name: Rossak Planitia
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; the source planet for the Bene Gesserit's original poison drug, or, the "Water of Life", and the origin of the Bene Gesserit order itself.

feature.name: Royllo Insula
feature.origin: Island in Atlantic Ocean (15th Century maps) on verge of the unknown, near Antilla and St. Brandan.

feature.name: Salusa Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; Salusa Secundus, used as the Imperial Prison Planet.

feature.name: Santorini Facula
feature.origin: Greek island also known as Thira.

feature.name: Seldon Fretum
feature.origin: Hari Seldon, the fictional, intellectual hero of Isaac Asimov's Foundation Series, First Minister of the Galactic Empire.

feature.name: Selk
feature.origin: Egyptian goddess of knowledge, writing, education, and reptiles.

feature.name: Senkyo
feature.origin: Japanese ideal realm of aloofness and serenity, freedom from wordly cares and death.

feature.name: Shangri-La
feature.origin: Tibetan mythical land of eternal youth.

feature.name: Sikun Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series, home to the useful plant akarso.

feature.name: Sinlap
feature.origin: Kachin (N. Burma) wise spirit who dwells in the sky and gives wisdom to his worshippers.

feature.name: Soi
feature.origin: Melanesian (New Ireland Island, Papua New Guinea) god of wisdom.

feature.name: Taniquetil Montes
feature.origin: Name of a mountain from Middle-earth, the fictional setting in fantasy novels by J.R.R. Tolkien.

feature.name: Tleilax Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; home world of the Bene Tleilax.

feature.name: Tollan Terra
feature.origin: Aztec paradise where crops never fade.

feature.name: Tortola Facula
feature.origin: Island in the British Virgin Islands.

feature.name: Trevize Fretum
feature.origin: Golan Trevize, fictional character in Isaac Asimov's Foundation Series, councilman of the planet Terminus.

feature.name: Tsiipiya Terra
feature.origin: Hopi name for Mount Taylor (New Mexico, US), as a sacred mountain.

feature.name: Tui Regio
feature.origin: Chinese goddess of happiness, joy, and water.

feature.name: Tupile Labyrinthus
feature.origin: Planet from the Dune series; “sanctuary planet” for defeated houses of the Imperium.

feature.name: Vid Flumina
feature.origin: In Norse mythology, a broad river of the ice-cold poisonous Elivagar system.

feature.name: Winia Fluctus
feature.origin: Indonesian first woman, known for her great beauty.

feature.name: Xanadu
feature.origin: An imaginary country in Coleridge's "Kubla Khan."

feature.name: Yalaing Terra
feature.origin: Australian spirit land filled with game and clean water for good souls.

feature.name: Zephyrus Undae
feature.origin: Greek personification of the gentle west wind.
